The specified value has been assigned to a stack location.

Load or store it there, with appropriate extension if necessary.

### assignValueToAddress() {#aa0e53803ef9c1e4cee4e195ced9c0841}

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
An overload which takes an ArgInfo if additional information about the arg is needed.

<code>ValRegIndex</code> is the index in <code>Arg.Regs</code> for the value to store.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpucalllowering-cpp/#l00245">245</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpucalllowering-cpp">AMDGPUCallLowering.cpp</a>.

### getStackAddress() {#a6901759e2aab843e39497ccb23a0c3cd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Register anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUCallLowering.cpp&#125;::AMDGPUOutgoingArgHandler::getStackAddress (uint64&#95;t MemSize, int64&#95;t Offset, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> &amp; MPO, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/isd/argflagsty">ISD::ArgFlagsTy</a> Flags)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Materialize a VReg containing the address of the specified stack-based object.

This is either based on a FrameIndex or direct SP manipulation, depending on the context. <code>MPO</code> should be initialized to an appropriate description of the address created.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpucalllowering-cpp/#l00193">193</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpucalllowering-cpp">AMDGPUCallLowering.cpp</a>.

Unused elsewhere.
